member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.AutoFiller
member.summary: Represents a class to receive data from database or other datasource, fills them into the designed fields of the template pdf and at last generates new pdf file or stream. It has two template file input modes:input as a stream or a pdf file. It has four types of output modes:one merged stream, one merged file, many small streams, many small files. It can recieve literal data contained in a System.Data.DataTable.

member.param: The dataTable which contains all the data from database or other data source.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Form.SetLicenseCOM(System.String)
member.summary: Obsolete. Licenses this component to use in a COM application.

remarks.p: Use this class for licenses purchased before 2005/01/22. Aspose has upgraded to a new licensing system, please use License. for licenses purchased after that date.

example.code:
[Visual Basic]
Dim RS Set RS = CreateObject("ADODB.Recordset") RS.Open _ "SELECT TOP 50 * FROM Customers ORDER BY Country, CompanyName", _ "Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=Northwind.mdb"
Dim Pdf.Form Set Pdf.Form = CreateObject("Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Form")
Pdf.Form.SetLicenseCOM "C:\MyPath\MyLicense.lic"
...

member.param: The license filename with its path.

remarks.p: Use this class for licenses purchased before 2005/01/22. Aspose has upgraded to a new licensing system, please use License. for licenses purchased after that date.

member.param: The license filename with its path.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Form.SetLicense(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Obsolete. Licenses this component to use in a Windows application.

remarks.p: Use this class for licenses purchased before 2005/01/22. Aspose has upgraded to a new licensing system, please use License. for licenses purchased after that date.
Use this method when you use Al.exe to assemble the license file into your assembly.

member.example:
Please make sure to create licenseReader using UnicodeEncoding.UTF7:
[C#]
StreamReader licenseReader = new StreamReader(licenseFile, UnicodeEncoding.UTF7); Pdf.Form.SetLicense(licenseReader);
[Visual Basic]
Dim licenseReader As StreamReader = New StreamReader(licenseFile,UnicodeEncoding.UTF7) Pdf.Form.SetLicense(licenseReader)
member.param: Where to read the license from.

member.example:

The page that requests this object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the middle data container, one DataTable. It must be defined before converting data from one format to another format. member.summary: Reset all visual attribtues to empty value.

members.member:
Copies an existing field to a new position pecified by page number and ordinates. A new document will be produced, which contains everything the source document has except for the newly copied field.
The old fully qualified field name. The new fully qualified field name.If null, it will be set as fieldName + "~". member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.AnnotationColor
member.summary: The color attribute of annoatations,each color is mapped to a value between 0 and 255 then converted to hexadecimal (00 to FF). The three hexadecimal values are concatenated and prefixed with a hash sign.Example:color="#FFFF00".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.Rectangle
member.summary: The annotation rectangle, defining the location of the annotation on the page in default user space units. The value is four comma separated real numbers which may be positive or negative.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.Flags
member.summary: A set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation.Value is a comma separated list containing the values: invisible,hidden,print,nozoom,norotate,noview, readonly,locked,togglenoview Example:flags="print,locked".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.CreatetionDate
member.summary: The date and time when the annotation was created.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.ModifiedDate
member.summary: The date and time when the annotation was most recently modified.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.Subject
member.summary: The text representing a short description of the subject being addressed by the annotation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.Coordinates
member.summary: Value is one or more groups of 8 comma separated real numbers. Groups are separated by commas. An array of 8 x n numbers specifying the coordinates of n quadrilaterals in default user space. Each quadrilateral encompasses a word or group of contiguous words in the text underlying the annotation. The coordinates for each quadrilateral are given in the order:x1,y1,x2,y2,x3,y3,x4,y4 specifying the quadrilateral's four vertices in counterclockwise order. The text is oriented with respect to the edge connecting points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.Justification
member.summary: A code specifying the form of quadding (justification) to be used in displaying the annotation's text.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in points. If this value is 0, no border is drawn.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the border style.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.BorderDashes
member.summary: A comma separated list of numbers defining a pattern of dashes and gaps to be used in drawing a dashed border. The dash phase is not specified and is assumed to be 0. For example, a dashes attribute with value "3,2" specifies a border drawn with 3-point dashes alternating with 2-point gaps. Values are: 1 or more numbers separated by a comma. For example:3;3,5;4,3,2,3.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.LineStart
member.summary: Two comma separated real numbers specify the starting coordinates in the annotation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.LineEnd
member.summary: Two comma separated real numbers specify the ending coordinates in the annotation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.LineHeadShape
member.summary: The line end for the head,the name specifying the line ending styles to be used in drawing the line.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.LineTailShape
member.summary: The line end for the tail,the name specifying the line ending styles to be used in drawing the line, Values for head and tail are:None (Default), Square,Circle,Diamond,OpenArrow,ClosedArrow,Butt,ROpenArrow,RClosedArrow.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.InteriorColor
member.summary: The interior color with which to fill the annotation's line endings,rectangle,ellipse,polygon,polyline etc.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.Annotation.Fringe
member.summary: The firnge attribute is a set of four values describing the numerical differences between two rectangles: the Rect entry of the annotation and the actual boundaries of the underlying object.

member.summary: Displayes the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and top entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.summary: Displayes the page with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.BookMark.FIT_BOUNDINGBOX_HORIZONTAL
member.summary: Displayes the page with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.BookMark.FIT_BOUNDINGBOX_VERTICAL
member.summary: Display the page with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.BookMark.FIT_BOUNDINGBOX
member.summary: Displayes the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.summary: Display the page with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom.

member.summary: Display the page with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.summary: Sets the print level of document's privilege. Just as the Adobe Professional's Printing Allowed settings. 0: None. 1: Low Resolution (150 dpi). 2: High Resolution.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.DocumentPrivilege.ChangeAllowLevel
member.summary: Sets the change level of document's privilege. Just as the Adobe Professional's Changes Allowed settings. 0: None. 1: Inserting, Deleting and Rotating pages. 2: Filling in form fields and signing existing signature fields. 3: Commenting, filling in form fields, and signing existing signature fields. 4: Any except extracting pages.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.DocumentPrivilege.CopyAllowLevel
member.summary: Sets the copy level of document's privilege. Just as the Adobe Professional's permission settings. 0: None. 1: Enable text access for screen reader devices for the visually impaired. 2: Enable copying of text, images and other content.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.FormattedText.#ctor(System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Kit.FontColor,Aspose.Pdf.Kit.FontStyle,Aspose.Pdf.Kit.EncodingType,System.Boolean,System.Single)

The color of the text showed.
The font of the text showed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType
member.summary: Enums the transition type of pages.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.SPLITVOUT
member.summary: Two lines sweep across the screen, revealing the new page. The lines are vertical and move outward from the center.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.SPLITHOUT
member.summary: Two lines sweep across the screen, revealing the new page. The lines are horizontal and move outward from the center.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.SPLITVIN
member.summary: Two lines sweep across the screen, revealing the new page. The lines are vertical and move inward from the edges of the page.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.SPLITHIN
member.summary: Two lines sweep across the screen, revealing the new page. The lines are horizontal and move inward from the edges of the page.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.BLINDV
member.summary: Multiple lines, evenly spaced across the screen, synchronously sweep in the same direction to reveal the new page. The lines are vertical.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.BLINDH
member.summary: Multiple lines, evenly spaced across the screen, synchronously sweep in the same direction to reveal the new page. The lines are horizontal.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.INBOX
member.summary: A rectangular box sweeps inward from the edges of the page.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.OUTBOX
member.summary: A rectangular box sweeps outward from the center.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.LRWIPE
member.summary: A single line sweeps across the screen from left to right.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.RLWIPE
member.summary: A single line sweeps across the screen from right to left.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.BTWIPE
member.summary: A single line sweeps across the screen from bottom to top.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.TBWIPE
member.summary: A single line sweeps across the screen from top to bottom.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.DISSOLVE
member.summary: The old page dissolves gradually to reveal the new one.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.LRGLITTER
member.summary: Similar to Dissolve, except that the effect sweeps across the page in a wide band moving from the left side of the screen to the right.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.TBGLITTER
member.summary: Top-Bottom Glitter.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PageTransitionType.DGLITTER
member.summary: Diagonal Glitter.

member.summary:
NOTE: This is Beta version of PdfConverter. And we may be not able to improve its performance in short time.
Represents a class to convert a pdf file's each page to images, supporting BMP, JPEG, PNG and TIFF now. Supported content in pdfs: pictures, form, comment. Picture quality: not very clear, but it is enough to support the fax. Conversion rate: one page 2 seconds.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfFileEditor.Concatenate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Merges two Pdf documents into a new Pdf document with pages in alternate ways and fill the blank places with blank pages. e.g.: document1 has 5 pages: p1, p2, p3, p4, p5. document2 has 3 pages: p1', p2', p3'. Merging the two Pdf document will produce the result document with pages:p1, p1', p2, p2', p3, p3', p4, blankpage, p5, blankpage.
member.param: The first Pdf document.
The second Pdf document.
The Pdf document with blank page
Output Pdf document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfFileEditor.MakeNUp(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Makes N-Up document from the two input PDF files to outputFile. Each page of outputFile will contain two pages, one page is from the first input file and another is from the second input file. The two pages are piled up horizontally. Use this method before 2007/12/15. Aspose has replaced it to MakeNUp(String[], String, bool) Please use new class after that date.
member.param: first input file.
second input file.
Output pdf file path and name.

second input stream.
Output pdf stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfFileEditor.MakeNUp(System.String[],System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes N-Up document from the multi input PDF files to outputFile. Each page of outputFile will contain multi pages, which are combination with pages in the input files of the same page number. The multi pages piled up horizontally if isSidewise is true and piled up vertically if isSidewise is false.
member.param: Input Pdf files.
Output pdf file path and name.
Piled up way, true for horizontally and flase for vertically.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfFileEditor.MakeNUp(System.IO.Stream[],System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes N-Up document from the multi input PDF streams to outputStream. The multi-pages piled up horizontally if isSidewise is true and piled up vertically if isSidewise is false.
member.param: Input Pdf streams.
Output pdf stream. Piled up way, true for horizontally and flase for vertically

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfFileSecurity.EncryptFile(System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Kit.DocumentPrivilege,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encrypts Pdf file with userpassword and ownerpassword and sets the document's privileges to access. The user password and the owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the input owner password is null or empty.
member.param: User password.
Owner password.
Set privilege.
True for 128 bits encryption, false is 40 bits encryption.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass","ownerpass",DocumentPrivilege.Print,true);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass","ownerpass",DocumentPrivilege.Print,true)

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfFileSignature
member.summary: Represents a class to sign a pdf file with a certificate.

members.member: These values indicate the author’s specification of which changes to the document will invalidate the signature. NOT_CERTIFIED represents not validating signature, CERTIFIED_NO_CHANGES_ALLOWED represents that no changes to the document are permitted, any change to the document invalidates the signature. CERTIFIED_FORM_FILLING represents that permitted changes are filling in forms, instantiating page templates,and signing; other changes invalidate the signature. CERTIFIED_FORM_FILLING_AND_ANNOTATIONS that permitted changes are the same as for CERTIFIED_FORM_FILLING, as well as annotation creation,deletion, and modification; other changes invalidate the signature. The default value is 2

CERTIFIED_FORM_FILLING represents that permitted changes are filling in forms, instantiating page templates,and signing; other changes invalidate the signature. CERTIFIED_FORM_FILLING_AND_ANNOTATIONS that permitted changes are the same as for CERTIFIED_FORM_FILLING, as well as annotation creation,deletion, and modification; other changes invalidate the signature. The default value is 2

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfFileStamp.AddPageNumber(System.String,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds page number in each pages of the pdf file,besides,page number's position can be setted,simultaneity,the exact position can be confirmed according to one or two values among leftMargin,rightMargin,topMargin,bottomMargin,if a parameter is zero, the parameter can be ignored.
member.param: The format of page number string, must contain one and only one "#", such as "Page #". The "#" string will be replaced with page number.

the page number's position. 0-bottom middle, 1-bottom right, 2-upper right, 3-sides right, 4-upper middle,5-bottom left,6-sides left,7-upper left.Default is 0, means page number position is bottom middle.
The distance between the left edge of the page and the left end of the page number string.
The distance between the right edge of the page and the right end of the page number string.
The distance between the top edge of the page and the top of the page number string.
The distance between the bottom edge of the page and the bottom of the page number string.

The y coordinate of the position where the page number is added.

example.code: [C#] System.String inFile = "text.pdf"; System.String outFile = "textwithpagenumber.pdf"; PdfFileStamp fileStamp = null; fileStamp = new PdfFileStamp(inFile, outFile); FormattedText ft = new FormattedText("Page #.",System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb((0,200,0), FontStyle.TimesRoman,EncodingType.Winansi,false,12); fileStamp.AddPageNumber(ft,5,15,0,0,20); fileStamp.Close(); [Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "text.pdf" Dim outFile As String = "textwithpagenumber.pdf" Dim fileStamp As PdfFileStamp = Nothing fileStamp = New PdfFileStamp(inFile, outFile) 'add page number Dim ft As FormattedText = New FormattedText("Page #.",System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb((0,200,0), FontStyle.TimesRoman,EncodingType.Winansi,False,12) fileStamp.addPageNumber(ft,5,15,0,0,20) fileStamp.close()

The distance between the left edge of the page and the left end of the header string,if the value is zero,it can be ignored.
The distance between the right edge of the page and the right end of the header string,if the value is zero,it can be ignored.

example.code: [C#] System.String inFile = "header.pdf"; System.String outFile = "header_out.pdf"; PdfFileStamp fileStamp = null; fileStamp = new PdfFileStamp(inFile, outFile); FormattedText ft = new FormattedText("Welcome to Aspose!",System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb((0,200,0), FontStyle.TimesRoman,EncodingType.Winansi,false,12); fileStamp.AddHeader(ft,5,15,0,0,20); fileStamp.Close(); [Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "header.pdf" Dim outFile As String = "header_out.pdf" Dim fileStamp As PdfFileStamp = Nothing fileStamp = New PdfFileStamp(inFile, outFile) Dim ft As FormattedText = New FormattedText("Welcome to Aspose!",System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb((0,200,0), FontStyle.TimesRoman,EncodingType.Winansi,False,12) fileStamp.AddHeader(ft,5,15,0,0,20) fileStamp.close()

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfViewer
member.summary:
NOTE: This is Beta version of PdfViewer. Some features may not be supported well and we may be not able to fix them in short time.
Represents a class to view or print a pdf. Print quality: it is not as high as the Adobe Reader since it really prints pictures converted from a pdf. It is necessary to make sure whether it can meet your quality requirement. Conversion rate: one page 2 seconds.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfViewer.OpenPdfFile(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a Pdf file, but does not actually decode the pages of the Pdf file. At last you must explicitly close the open file using the closePdfFile() to release all the memory.
member.param: The path of Pdf file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfViewer.OpenPdfFile(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens a Pdf file stream. But does not actually decode the pages of the Pdf file. At last you must explicitly close the open file using the closePdfFile() to release all the memory.
member.param: The pdf stream to be opened.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.String)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf file. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance. At last you must explicitly close the open file using the closePdfFile() to release all the memory.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.
member.param: The path of Pdf file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf stream. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance. At last you must explicitly close the open file using the closePdfFile() to release all the memory.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.
member.param: The pdf stream to be opened and printed..

example.code:
[C#] PdfViewer viewer = new PdfViewer(); viewer.AutoResize = true; //print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true; //print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintLargePdf(new MemoryStream(File.ReadAllBytes(@"d:\test.pdf"))); viewer.ClosePdfFile();
[VisualBasic] Dim viewer As PdfViewer = new PdfViewer(); viewer.AutoResize = true 'print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true 'print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintLargePdf(new MemoryStream(File.ReadAllBytes(@"d:\test.pdf"))) viewer.ClosePdfFile()

example.code:

[VisualBasic] Dim viewer As PdfViewer = new PdfViewer() viewer.OpenPdfFile(@"d:\test.pdf") viewer.AutoResize = true 'print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true 'print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintDocumentWithSetup() viewer.ClosePdfFile()

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Kit.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.
